properties.media:imagetext:
FLOYD
2% china at l Avlation Corp.,
Chungking, China.
Dear Nellie,
3 September, 1935.
Your letter of August 10th arrived while I
was on a visit to the family at Peking following my return
from Manila.
When I
got back to Shanghai I learned that you
were in the city and tried all one afternoon to get in touch
with you, leaving word with your boy for you to call me at
the Metropole Hotel.
I was very sorry I did not have a chance
to see you at this time.
Your letter about the trip to Li Kiang is
most intriguing and I would like nothing better than the opp-
ortunity to join you on that expedition,
however, it
is nec-
essary for me to return to Manila, leaving here on the 10th
September.
I will be away for over a month and during that
time you will undoubtedly return to Shanghai and I therefore
suggest that you report the opportunity for charter to the
Operations Department for such
consideration as they may wish
to give Dr. Rock's proposition.
I made a quick trip to Peiping last week and
found the family well and happy.
Frances, Bo
and Ruth Stevens
were all away on a jaunt to the Diamond Mountains of Korea but
were due back on September lst.
Ruth is sailing on the Pres-
ident Hoover on September 10th and I am taking Frances with me
to Manila, sailing on the same date.
At the present time, the remaining members
of the family have no definite
plans.
I hope you are having
good luck
showing O'Hara all the nice level Kansas-like fields
in Kweichow and Yunnan and that you will soon be back in Shanghai.
Please give my very kindest regards to 0*Hara,
Mrs. 0'Hara and Bud.
Very sincerely yours,
H.M. Bixby
de80,/S/Plos
